attributes.action: Change the age woman get cervical screenings from 25 to 18.
attributes.additional_details: Changing the age would mean more individuals getting checked out and less deaths caused by cervical cancer.
attributes.background: Routine cervical screening commences at 25 years of age. Lots of individuals have been diagnosed too late who are under the age of 25 because they don't get a routine checks until that age.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325302
